issue.title: Fix IPv6 address rendering

repository.name: mitmproxy

issue.body:
This fixes the IPv6 formatting issue.
![screenshot from 2017-03-19 17-26-07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9962817/24080864/7f3df7a6-0ccd-11e7-8156-fb73b30a6774.png)

fixes #2109

body: @PiyushGoyal443: If you look closely, you'll see that there's an open PR linked above.

issue.title: Fixes mitmproxy crashes when can't resolve address ( due to internet connectivity issues )

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body:
##### Steps to reproduce the problem : ( There may be other ways )

1. Disconnect the internet.
2. Try to access a website, this comes up ( 172.31.1.5 is my college proxy server )

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17861054/24070663/dfaac81c-0be7-11e7-8f7d-757cda62108c.png)

3. When you open the flow and move on to Details tab , this error comes up .

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17861054/24070734/083e086a-0be9-11e7-8fd6-d7f10ea96944.png)


##### Reason :
This code in **/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/tools/console/flowdetailview.py** at *line 34*
```
    if sc is not None:
        text.append(urwid.Text([("head", "Server Connection:")]))
        parts = [
            ["Address", "{}:{}".format(sc.address[0], sc.address[1])],
            ["Resolved Address", "{}:{}".format(sc.ip_address[0], sc.ip_address[1])],
        ]
        if resp:
            parts.append(["HTTP Version", resp.http_version])
        if sc.alpn_proto_negotiated:
            parts.append(["ALPN", sc.alpn_proto_negotiated])

        text.extend(
            common.format_keyvals(parts, key="key", val="text", indent=4)
        )
```

Even though **sc** ( here a **ServerConnection** object defined in **/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/connections.py** ) is _not_ **None** but its attribute `sc.ip_address` is **None** , since without internet it couldn't be resolved.

#### After Fix 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17861054/24070670/fab3ff16-0be7-11e7-8e6e-7d6149e89a04.png)


### ToDo
I still couldn't think of any possible use cases apart from internet being disconnected in between the work.
Would love to know any other use cases where this could have prop up. 

#### System information

Mitmproxy version: 3.0.0 (2.0.0dev0203-0xc0882496) 
Python version: 3.5.3
Platform: Linux-4.6.0-kali1-amd64-x86_64-with-Kali-kali-rolling-kali-rolling
SSL version: OpenSSL 1.1.0e  16 Feb 2017
Linux distro: Kali kali-rolling kali-rolling
